title: National Television Awards 2020: Mrs Brown beats Ricky Gervais and Fleabag
description: The sitcom wins for a fifth year, while Ant and Dec, Jesy Nelson and Michael Palin are also honoured.

title: Coronavirus: Australian scientists first to recreate virus outside China
description: Scientists say it could be a "game changer" in efforts to contain the deadly disease.

title: How will the Huawei 5G deal affect me?
description: The UK has decided to let Huawei continue to be used in its 5G networks but with restrictions, despite pressure from the US to block the firm.

title: Haunting image of trapped sea turtle wins underwater photo award
description: Shane Gross captured the haunting photo while diving near the island of Eleuthera in the Bahamas.

title: Trump's Middle East peace plan: Smiles and sorrow on the ground
description: President Donald Trump calls the strategy a win-win opportunity for both sides - but is it?

title: Hound of Hounslow: Who is Navinder Sarao, the 'flash crash trader'?
description: A self-taught British trader has been sentenced for his role in a £1tn US stock market crash.

title: National Television Awards 2020: Red carpet in pictures
description: The biggest names in telly stepped out in force for the 25th NTAs.

title: Northern rail franchise: 'The actual service is atrocious'
description: Commuters and business owners in one village express their frustration about rail disruption.

title: Brexit: 'The best now is for it to be done and finalised'
description: Beer boss Sarah John wants to know what's happening with Brexit, and for things to be "finalised".

title: Jeffrey Epstein accusers outraged by Prince Andrew's 'lack of co-operation'
description: US lawyers, representing some of the late Jeffrey Epstein's accusers, urge the duke to assist the probe.

title: Huawei set for limited role in UK 5G networks
description: The US failed to convince the Prime Minister to ban the Chinese firm from any involvement.

title: Coronavirus: Hong Kong to slash border travel as virus spreads
description: It wants to drastically reduce visits from mainland China, where the death toll has reached 106.

title: Federer saves seven match points in Australian Open quarter-final win
description: Roger Federer saves seven match points before beating unseeded American Tennys Sandgren in a sensational Australian Open quarter-final.

title: Nicholas Parsons: 'Broadcasting legend' dies aged 96 after short illness
description: Nicholas Parsons, comedy's great straight man who hosted Radio 4's Just a Minute, has died aged 96.

title: Coronavirus: Britons in China want more support from UK
description: UK citizens criticise the government response as No 10 says it is "finalising" plans for their return.

title: Obituary: Nicholas Parsons
description: The unflappable chairman of BBC Radio 4's Just A Minute, and one of the best straight men in the business.

title: MoT: Q&A on test suspensions in Northern Ireland
description: What is happening and how is a widespread suspension of testing affecting drivers?

title: Immigration salary threshold should drop by £4,400, says committee
description: The Migration Advisory Committee says the lower amount would help recruit NHS staff and teachers.

title: Beeching rail cuts: Fund to restore lines goes ahead amid criticism
description: The transport secretary is to unveil the first two railway lines to receive funding to restore rural services.

title: Heavy snow strands drivers overnight on M74
description: Commuters across the country are warned that wintry conditions could affect journeys.

title: Banks asked to explain 40% overdraft rates
description: The City watchdog says most banks have set "very similar prices" under the new rules.

title: Oscars 2020: Ten things we spotted in the class photo
description: The annual Academy Awards luncheon had all the quirks and questionable outfits you could ask for.

title: Coronavirus: Wuhan residents shout from windows in solidarity
description: Residents in the quarantined city battling a virus outbreak are shouting and singing to boost morale.

title: 'Simeone is the best manager in the world' - Trippier on life at Atletico Madrid... and Sean Dyche
description: Atletico Madrid right-back Kieran Trippier talks about life in Spain, playing under Diego Simeone and becoming a better defender.

title: I will continue Kobe Bryant legacy - LeBron James
description: LeBron James says he is "heartbroken" over the death of Kobe Bryant and promises to continue his fellow basketball great's legacy.

title: The Papers: Prince Andrew 'snubs FBI' and Holocaust remembered
description: Tuesday's papers feature claims the Duke of York has provided "zero cooperation" to the FBI's Epstein investigation.

title: Bride Price: 'My husband can't afford me'
description: Some cultures exchange money before a marriage, but should we continue the Bride Price tradition?

title: Antarctica melting: Climate change and the journey to the 'doomsday glacier'
description: Thwaites Glacier, also known as the "doomsday glacier", is reported to be melting quicker than previously thought - scientists are now trying to find out why.

title: Barty beats Kvitova to reach Australian Open semi-finals
description: Top seed Ashleigh Barty beats Petra Kvitova to reach the Australian Open semi-finals, where she will face American Sofia Kenin.

title: Up Helly Aa: The songwriter who introduced Vikings to Shetland's fire festival
description: How the politics of the day influenced the modern-day Shetland fire festivals.

title: Watchdog queries impact of £46m 'Get Ready for Brexit' campaign
description: The £46m publicity blitz did not leave people "significantly better prepared", says the NAO.

title: Work, protest and play on the streets of Hackney
description: Neil Martinson's pictures of Hackney in the 1970s and 80s.

title: Kobe Bryant 'learnt from his mistakes' - Monique Currie
description: Former basketball player Monique Currie praised Kobe Bryant for his work in the women's game.

title: Berkshire parents seek diagnosis for son's unknown syndrome
description: Ethan has impaired growth and restricted vision, but doctors do not know why.

title: Brexit: Tears and relief as the UK's MEPs bid farewell
description: It's been a "grim" last week for some but others are "delighted" to be leaving the European Parliament.

title: Are your houseplants bad for the environment?

title: The silenced YouTube stars of Indian-administered Kashmir
description: Kashmiri Kalkharabs, a popular Kashmiri YouTube channel, has been forced into silence since August.

title: 'I left a house party and got crushed under a car'
description: Annie Butt, who broke 24 bones in a crash caused by a fellow partygoer, recalls the night she nearly died.

title: Letter from Africa: The 'leopard unit', vigilantes and Nigeria's kidnap crisis
description: A plan by Nigeria's south-western states to start a new security unit divides the country.

title: Don Cameron: The Scot shaping the history of hot air balloons

title: Can anyone call themself a therapist or a counsellor?
description: A lack of regulation around private therapy and counselling can leave some qualifications meaningless.

title: Visit Nepal's yeti: How mythical creature divided Himalayan nation
description: An idea to bring more tourists to Nepal has ended in a row over what a yeti actually looks like.

title: Super Bowl 2020: The NFL Academy & its first students on new path to US game
description: The NFL opened a new academy in north London in September. Its 90 students are the first to step out on a new path towards the USA.
